channel.title: Open source 2d Java games?
channel.description: Does anyone know of any 2d, opensource java games that peferably can be run in browsers? I was thinking something like pokemon, or maybe a mario games but hopefully someone has a full webbrowser based rom emulater lying around. :P

item.title: Open source 2d Java games?
item.dc:creator: @Hiaburi Hiaburi
item.description:
@Hiaburi wrote:

i got one, its a sand like game, not really like an rpg, more like something to do when bored. i will post it eventually, but i want to add more to it first

Read full topic

item.title: Open source 2d Java games?
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

frank_:

javaboy is a java gameboy colour emulator, its open source, i cbf getting a url for ya

Thanks, I’ll do a search for it.

[quote=“Miss Silabsoft, post:4, topic:95820”]i did a quick google for you, here are some things that looked promising,

https://jrpg.dev.java.net/

if you want i have a half written frankenstien ive been playing with your welcome too, pm me if you want it.

however making your own really isnt all that difficult, You have your main applet, your main image then just pass the image around to have different things drawn on it.[br][size=1]Posted on: May 17, 2007, 09:43:12 AM[/size][hr]http://dnd.no-ip.org/bugrunner.rar[/quote]

I’ll check it out later on tonight. Thanks!

Read full topic
